data.title: Southwest Airlines Company's (LUV) Profit Margin at 2.26% (2013
data.meta_description: Want to know the net profit margin of SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO for latest year and other previous years? This report will help you. You will find charts (annual and quarterly) and other useful sections to analyze the profit margin in this report.
data.text:
Curious about SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO's net profit margin for 2023 and previous years? This report has got you covered. Inside, you'll discover charts (both annual and quarterly) and other informative sections for a thorough analysis of the profit margin. Additionally, you'll find insights to compare net margin with gross margin and net income.

Note: Unlike its gross counterpart, net profit margin takes into account most expenses, including the cost of goods sold, employee payroll, logistics costs, interest, and taxes. For this reason, many investors prefer analyzing net profit margin over gross or operating margins.

This report comprises five sections. Below, you'll find a table of contents for easy navigation.

SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO Profit Margin by Year

LUV Profit Margin by Quarter

LUV Net Margin vs. Net Income vs. Revenue

SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO's 5 Highest Quarterly Profit Margin Figures

LUV's 5 Lowest Quarterly Profit Margin Figures

Please note that the data presented in this report covers the period from 2013 to 2023. We are committed to keeping this report up-to-date with the latest margin values. We highly recommend bookmarking this page for future reference.

It's important to clarify that when someone refers to "profit margin" without a specific prefix, they are generally talking about the "net margin." That's how significant this metric is in financial discussions.

1 SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO Profit Margin by Year

The first section is of utmost significance as it provides a detailed breakdown of LUV's net profit margin for each year up to 2023.

Please take note: Monitoring annual net profit margin values holds great importance for potential investors. This metric not only reflects internal factors such as the company's performance (efficiency of operations, cost-cutting measures, automation, etc.) but also external factors like changes in government taxes and interest rates.

The graph below illustrates the net margin values of SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO as vertical bars.

Now, let's explore a table that presents net profit margin values in numeric form. Each row represents a year, and the final column allows you to observe the changes between consecutive annual values, providing insight into the trend of the net margin curve.

YearProfit Margin (%)Change From Previous Year20134.2620146.111.85 (43.43%)2015114.89 (80.03%)201610.76-0.24 (-2.18%)201715.885.12 (47.58%)201811.22-4.66 (-29.35%)201910.26-0.96 (-8.56%)2020-33.97-44.23 (-431.09%)20216.1940.16 (-118.22%)20222.26-3.93 (-63.49%)

Let's break down the calculation of the profit margin using the net margin formula for SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO's performance in the year 2022.

For the year 2022, the Net Income of SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO was $539 Million.

The Revenue of LUV during the same year amounted to $23.81 Billion.

The Net Profit Margin is calculated as (Net Income / Revenue) x 100%, which equals 2.26%.

Between 2013 and 2022, LUV achieved its highest profit margin, reaching 15.88%. This peak performance was recorded in 2017. On the other hand, the lowest profit margin during this period was -33.97% in 2020. Tweet This

2 LUV Profit Margin by Quarter

The second section provides a detailed breakdown of SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO's net profit margin on a quarterly basis.

Below, you'll find a line graph that represents the margin values for 43 quarters. This graph allows you to observe subtle variations compared to the annual graph presented in the previous section.

Below, you'll find a table displaying net profit margin values in numerical form. The second column shows the margin values, while the third column illustrates the variations in margins between successive quarters.

Please take note: This table is a valuable resource for understanding trends between successive quarters. Additionally, many investors may also want to analyze how the margin has improved compared to the same quarter of the previous year. You can easily perform this analysis using the values provided in the table below.

Here's an intriguing fact: The highest quarterly net margin achieved by LUV was 33.23% until Q3-2023 from Q1-2013. This exceptional margin was reached during Q4-2017. Conversely, the lowest net margin recorded during this period was -90.77%, occurring during Q2-2020. Tweet This

3 LUV Net Margin vs. Net Income vs. Revenue

In this section, we present three critical figures—net margin, profit, and revenue—for SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO in a tabular format. Take a close look at the table below; you'll discover an intriguing observation shortly.

YearNet Profit ($)Net Profit Margin (%)Revenue2013754 Million4.2617.7 Billion20141.14 Billion6.1118.61 Billion20152.18 Billion1119.82 Billion20162.18 Billion10.7620.29 Billion20173.36 Billion15.8821.15 Billion20182.47 Billion11.2221.97 Billion20192.3 Billion10.2622.43 Billion2020-3.07 Billion-33.979.05 Billion2021977 Million6.1915.79 Billion2022539 Million2.2623.81 Billion

Observation: Let's explore whether the highest net margin coincided with the peak profit recorded. Interestingly, both the highest margin and net income were achieved in the same year, 2017.

4 SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO's 5 Highest Quarterly Profit Margin Figures

As you're aware, this report encompasses data from 2013 to 2023. In this section, we highlight the top quarters of LUV with the highest net margin values within that time frame.

First, let's examine a graph depicting the best net margin quarters for SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO. The height of each bar corresponds to the margin value. (For your reference, we've labeled the quarters along the X-axis.)

Below, you'll find a table featuring the top 5 quarters with the most remarkable net margin figures. The final column allows you to assess each quarter's figure in relation to the highest value, which stands at 33.23% in Q4-2017.

Quarter-YearProfit Margin (%)Change From Highest ValueQ4-201733.23Q2-201615.23-18 (-54.17%)Q2-201712.96-20.27 (-61%)Q2-201812.77-20.46 (-61.57%)Q2-201912.54-20.69 (-62.26%)

5 LUV's 5 Lowest Quarterly Profit Margin Figures

In the fifth section, we'll examine the five quarters during which SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO reported its lowest margin values. Initially, you'll find a graph depicting these quarters and their corresponding net margin values. Subsequently, we'll present a table similar to the previous section for further analysis.

Quarter-YearProfit Margin (%)Change From Lowest ValueQ2-2020-90.77Q3-2020-64.5326.24 (-28.91%)Q4-2020-45.1145.66 (-50.3%)Q1-2022-5.9284.85 (-93.48%)Q4-2022-3.5687.21 (-96.08%)

Please take note: This final section holds significant importance for potential investors. It provides a detailed examination of underperforming quarters, offering insights into potential future implications.

Conclusion

Profit is the lifeblood of any business. While not as critical as absolute net income, profit margin plays a crucial role. It's a key metric for comparing different companies within the same industry or geographical region. We trust that the report above has furnished you with valuable data for comparing SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO with its competitors.
